[Our courses](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/courses)
![](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/inline_teaser/public/cambridgeuniversity_0092_webres.jpg?h=e795c1e3&itok=imvvoWIV)
###  Courses at Cambridge
We offer 30 undergraduate courses covering more than 65 subject areas. Find a course that suits your interests.
* * *
[Cambridge Colleges](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/colleges)
![](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/inline_teaser/public/52522586766_f63274210c_k.jpg?h=64f380a1&itok=aABg1OkH)
###  Where you'll live
At Cambridge you'll be part of a College. Colleges are where our students live, work, rest and play.
* * *
[Applying to Cambridge](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/applying)
![](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/inline_teaser/public/cambridgeuniversity_0157_webres.jpg?h=fc3a0148&itok=bn8mBVq6)
###  How to apply
Our application process starts earlier and is a bit different to other universities. Follow our guide on applying.
* * *
[International student community](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/international-students)
![](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/inline_teaser/public/world-map-2015-giant-poster-1.11.jpg?h=5374c097&itok=vcoOuyQ_)
###  International students
Applying from outside of the UK? Find out about life at Cambridge as an international student.
* * *
[Financing your studies](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/finance)
![](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/inline_teaser/public/dscf9984.jpg?h=0edc5323&itok=DJc-i8ce)
###  Fees and funding
You'll need to consider your tuition and living costs at university. We offer lots of financial support to help you at Cambridge.
* * *
[Discover student life](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/student-life)
![](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/inline_teaser/public/cambridgeuniversity_0038_webres_-_tiny_jpg.jpg?h=50c68993&itok=jgtP7kHH)
###  Student life
Cambridge is a great place to be a student. You'll have access to world-class facilities, dedicated support services and many student societies.
* * *
[Guidance for teachers](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/find-out-more/teachers-and-advisers)
![](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/inline_teaser/public/cambridgeuniversity_0152_webres_0.jpg?h=a11326e2&itok=nlkQfzhK)
###  Teachers and advisers
Advising students about their university options? We have information and resources to help you to guide them.
* * *
## Follow Us
[![Facebook](https://www.postgraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/files/facebook_icon.svg)](https://www.cam.ac.uk/facebook) [![Instagram](https://www.postgraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/files/instagram_icon.svg)](https://www.instagram.com/cambridgeuniversity/) [![Twitter](https://www.postgraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/files/twitter-x_icon.svg)](https://www.cam.ac.uk/twitter) [![YouTube](https://www.postgraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/files/youtube_icon.svg)](https://www.cam.ac.uk/youtube) [![TikTok](https://www.postgraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/files/tiktok_icon.svg)](https://www.cam.ac.uk/tiktok)
## Join our Newsletter
Subscribe for updates on our latest events, news, advice and resources.
[Sign up](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/find-out-more/student-newsletter "Student Newsletter")
## Cambridge Open Days 2026
9 JULY
10 JULY
Our next [Open Days](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/events/cambridge-open-days "Cambridge Open Days") will be 9 and 10 July 2026.

## Students holding conditional offers for 2025
### If you meet or exceed all the conditions of your offer
In most cases you wonât need to do anything.
We will be made aware of your A level (or equivalent) results directly via UCAS, and your place will be confirmed. Your status will update on your UCAS Hub and youâll soon receive an email with further details.
If we donât receive your results directly via UCAS, then your Cambridge College should inform you where to send your results when they are received.
Please donât call us for updates on your application. In the meantime, take a look at our [information for new students](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/apply/after/new-undergraduate-students "Information for new students").
### If you donât quite meet the offer
In these circumstances, we'll need to know exactly how close you were to meeting your offer.
Where results are received directly via UCAS, they only provides us with your examination grades. Please send the relevant College details of your performance as soon as possible. This should be in the form of a scanned copy of your statement of results for each examination.
There may be a few spaces available at the College you applied to or at another College, depending on the number of students who have met their offers.
Please be patient. Your College will contact you as soon as possible and you can check the status of your application on your [UCAS Hub](http://www.ucas.com/track).
Please do not call the College or University for updates on your application. The Hub will be updated as soon as possible once a final decision is made.
### If your grades are substantially lower than those required by your offer
Unless there are special circumstances to consider, your application to Cambridge will have been unsuccessful. Hopefully, youâll have made the grades for your insurance offer.
Your status will be updated on your UCAS Hub so that you can take up your insurance place or enter Clearing. We don't enter Clearing, so there will be no course vacancies at the University through Clearing.
### If you don't receive all of your results
We know that sometimes there are processing problems and your Cambridge College may already be aware that youâre missing a particular result.
Please [contact your Cambridge College](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/colleges/college-contacts "College contacts") as soon as youâve received your missing results.
## What to do if we have invited you to apply for reconsideration
You might be eligible to have your application reconsidered if we told you about our August Reconsideration Pool in your decision letter or email in January. Some places will be available for selected students on courses that have space for October 2025.
For further information, see [August Reconsideration Pool](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/apply/after/apply-for-reconsideration "Applying for reconsideration in August").
## No Clearing vacancies
The University of Cambridge does not enter Clearing. We have no course vacancies available through Clearing.
Further information about Clearing is available from the [UCAS website](http://www.ucas.com/).

## Sign up to our Student Newsletter
Subscribe to our monthly student newsletter for information about upcoming events, application advice and other resources that might be of interest. [Sign up here](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/find-out-more/student-newsletter "Student Newsletter").
## Widening participation
Outreach initiatives and events are run each year both in Cambridge and in schools and colleges across the UK. [Find out more](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/find-out-more/widening-participation "Widening participation")
## Teachers and advisers
Information and resources for teachers and those advising students about their university options. [Find out more](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/find-out-more/teachers-and-advisers "Teachers and Advisers")
## Parents and supporters
Information and guidance for those supporting someone who is thinking about applying to Cambridge. [Find out more](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/parents)
## Application statistics
Use our interactive graph generator to view basic undergraduate application and admissions statistics based on course and College choice. [Find out more](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/apply/statistics)
## Getting here
The University of Cambridge is based in the East of England, in the UK. Find out how to get here by various modes of transport. [Find out more](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/find-out-more/getting-here "Getting here")
## Contact us
Should you have any further questions after browsing this website, please get in touch. [Find out more](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/find-out-more/contact-us "Contact Us")

Insight is a multi-year intervention for Pupil Premium students in local schools. It seeks to raise academic attainment, directly through GCSE Tutoring and indirectly through Oracy development, development of metacognitive skills and building academic confidence. The intervention runs from Year 8âYear 11, and takes place on visit days to the University, at partner schools, and online.
Through a series of engaging workshops students will be supported in the development of study skills that will help them with their GCSEs and beyond. They will have the opportunity to explore academic subjects that are not taught at school, in addition to finding out about different career possibilities.
In addition to raising the attainment of participants, Insight seeks to develop university self-efficacy and empower participants and their supporters to make informed decisions about future pathways. Students will receive timely advice and guidance to support in their decision making with regard to A-Level options and will be introduced to the university admissions process, if this is something they choose to move on to. Throughout the programme students will have the opportunity to interact with academics and student ambassadors studying at university.
Insight works with students who attend selected schools in Cambridgeshire. If you are a school interested in taking part in the Insight programme see [Insight for Schools](https://www.undergraduate.study.cam.ac.uk/insight-schools "Insight for Schools") for more information.
## Selection criteria
The University of Cambridge is committed to widening participation to higher education. As part of this work, we would like to work with and support students who may have experienced either educational disadvantage or belong to a group that is statistically less likely to progress to higher education. On the Insight programme, we work with high prior attaining pupils from our partner schools who are eligible for pupil premium.

## What is Apply: Cambridge?
Apply: Cambridge is the University's free applicant support programme for high-attaining students from underrepresented backgrounds and areas of the UK.
It's an intensive online programme:
  * with weekly activities until the UCAS deadline, including interview and admissions test practice
  * offering information, advice and guidance to help you make a competitive application to Cambridge
  * delivered by Cambridge staff, students and Admissions Tutors who will share their expertise on the application process


We will work with you every step of the way over a 6-month period, helping you navigate the admissions process and effectively prepare for your Cambridge application.
### What activities will I do on the programme?
  * Informational webinars, on topics like personal statements
  * Interactive workshops, on topics like subject-specific interviews and admissions test practice
  * Taster lectures
  * Q&A sessions with Admissions Tutors and current students
  * Mentoring from a current University of Cambridge student, including: 
    * virtual 1-1 mentoring over a text-based app and website
    * monthly group mentoring meetings with your mentor over Zoom
    * personal statement feedback


If you're given a place on the programme, you'll be expected to attend all activities live with your camera and microphone on. You should be ready to engage fully in the online sessions. Most activities will take place 5-6pm on weekdays, including during the summer holidays and school term time.
Applications for Apply: Cambridge 2025 are closed.
